download data ## download big cats-and-dogs.zip and we will random split into training and validation folder ::: {#d63a6ca9 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} os. getcwd() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ``` '/Users/jinchaoduan/Documents/R project/tensorflowing/Convolutional Neural Networks in TensorFlow' ``` ::: ::: ::: {#df9833e3 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} import os if not os.path.exists('tmp'): os.makedirs('tmp') ``` ::: ::: {#70a91bfe .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} import urllib.request urllib.request.urlretrieve("https://download.microsoft.com/download/3/E/1/3E1C3F21-ECDB-4869-8368-6DEBA77B919F/kagglecatsanddogs_5340.zip", "./tmp/cats-and-dogs.zip") ``` ::: ::: {#8c00145d .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} import zipfile local_zip = './tmp/cats-and-dogs.zip' zip_ref = zipfile.ZipFile(local_zip, 'r') zip_ref.extractall('./tmp') zip_ref.close() ``` ::: ::: {#365ab1ba .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} os.remove('./tmp/cats-and-dogs.zip') ``` ::: ::: {#c58284b5 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} os.listdir('./tmp/PetImages') ``` ::: ::: {#6a9a05c5 .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} # grader-required-cell source_path = '/tmp/PetImages' source_path_dogs = os.path.join(source_path, 'Dog') source_path_cats = os.path.join(source_path, 'Cat') # os.listdir returns a list containing all files under the given path print(f"There are {len(os.listdir(source_path_dogs))} images of dogs.") print(f"There are {len(os.listdir(source_path_cats))} images of cats.") ``` ::: ::: {#cb9f64ac .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} if not os.path.exists('./tmp/cats-v-dogs'): os.mkdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs') if not os.path.exists('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training'): os.mkdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training') if not os.path.exists('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing'): os.mkdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing') if not os.path.exists('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/cats'): os.mkdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/cats') if not os.path.exists('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/dogs'): os.mkdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/dogs') if not os.path.exists('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/cats'): os.mkdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/cats') if not os.path.exists('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/dogs'): os.mkdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/dogs') ``` ::: ::: {#fe548526 .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} def split_data(SOURCE, TRAINING, TESTING, SPLIT_SIZE): # YOUR CODE STARTS HERE all_files = [] for file_name in os.listdir(SOURCE): file_path = SOURCE + file_name if os.path.getsize(file_path): all_files.append(file_name) else: print('{} is zero length, so ignoring'.format(file_name)) n_files = len(all_files) split_point = int(n_files * SPLIT_SIZE) shuffled = random.sample(all_files, n_files) train_set = shuffled[:split_point] test_set = shuffled[split_point:] for file_name in train_set: copyfile(SOURCE + file_name, TRAINING + file_name) for file_name in test_set: copyfile(SOURCE + file_name, TESTING + file_name) ``` ::: ::: {#d33f49e0 .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} split_size = .9 CAT_SOURCE_DIR = "./tmp/PetImages/Cat/" TRAINING_CATS_DIR = "./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/cats/" TESTING_CATS_DIR = "./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/cats/" DOG_SOURCE_DIR = "./tmp/PetImages/Dog/" TRAINING_DOGS_DIR = "./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/dogs/" TESTING_DOGS_DIR = "./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/dogs/" ``` ::: ::: {#ddf252f4 .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} split_data(CAT_SOURCE_DIR, TRAINING_CATS_DIR, TESTING_CATS_DIR, split_size) split_data(DOG_SOURCE_DIR, TRAINING_DOGS_DIR, TESTING_DOGS_DIR, split_size) ``` ::: ::: {#39dd3526 .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.python .cell-code} print(len(os.listdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/cats/'))) print(len(os.listdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/dogs/'))) print(len(os.listdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/cats/'))) print(len(os.listdir('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/dogs/'))) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 12500 12500 6559 6454 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#3619705e .cell execution_count=14} ``` {.python .cell-code} from PIL import Image im = Image.open('./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/cats/11.jpg') im.size # (width,height) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=7} ``` (432, 410) ``` ::: ::: # Load the data ::: {#f7a514cb .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} train_dir='./tmp/cats-v-dogs/training/' validation_dir='./tmp/cats-v-dogs/testing/' ``` ::: ImageDataGenerator: All images will be resized to 150x150 and do augmentation to aviod over fiting ::: {#6bec2f09 .cell execution_count=16} ``` {.python .cell-code} train_datagen = ImageDataGenerator( rescale=1./255, rotation_range=40, width_shift_range=0.2, height_shift_range=0.2, shear_range=0.2, zoom_range=0.2, horizontal_flip=True, fill_mode='nearest') test_datagen = ImageDataGenerator(rescale=1./255) ``` ::: ::: {#4f62db29 .cell execution_count=17} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Flow training images in batches of 20 using train_datagen generator train_generator = train_datagen.flow_from_directory( train_dir, # This is the source directory for training images target_size=(150, 150), # All images will be resized to 150x150 batch_size=20, # Since we use binary_crossentropy loss, we need binary labels class_mode='binary') # Flow validation images in batches of 20 using test_datagen generator validation_generator = test_datagen.flow_from_directory( validation_dir, target_size=(150, 150), batch_size=20, class_mode='binary') ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Found 24998 images belonging to 2 classes. Found 13013 images belonging to 2 classes. ``` ::: ::: ::: {#d2040d0a .cell execution_count=18} ``` {.python .cell-code} import tensorflow as tf # Build the model model = tf.keras.models.Sequential([ # Note the input shape is the desired size of the image 300x300 with 3 bytes color # This is the first convolution tf.keras.layers.Conv2D(16, (3,3), activation='relu', input_shape=(150, 150, 3)), tf.keras.layers.MaxPooling2D(2, 2), # The second convolution tf.keras.layers.Conv2D(32, (3,3), activation='relu'), tf.keras.layers.MaxPooling2D(2,2), # The third convolution tf.keras.layers.Conv2D(64, (3,3), activation='relu'), tf.keras.layers.MaxPooling2D(2,2), # The fourth convolution tf.keras.layers.Conv2D(64, (3,3), activation='relu'), tf.keras.layers.MaxPooling2D(2,2), # The fifth convolution tf.keras.layers.Conv2D(64, (3,3), activation='relu'), tf.keras.layers.MaxPooling2D(2,2), # Flatten the results to feed into a DNN tf.keras.layers.Flatten(), # 512 neuron hidden layer tf.keras.layers.Dense(512, activation='relu'), # Only 1 output neuron. It will contain a value from 0-1 where 0 for 1 class ('horses') and 1 for the other ('humans') tf.keras.layers.Dense(1, activation='sigmoid') ]) ``` ::: ::: {#50fb163e .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.python .cell-code} model.summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
